Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw a fish and its environment, showing where the fish lives.
The student can label the basic resources that the fish needs, such as water and food.
The student can illustrate and label the parts of the habitat that provide for the fish's needs, like water for swimming and plants for protection.
The student can depict and label other living things that might share the habitat with the fish.
The student can illustrate and explain the relationships between the fish and its habitat, including how the habitat meets the fish's needs for survival.
The student can describe how the fish and other parts of the habitat work together as a system to support life.
